analyzed: ga ne k'a char sprin no //

analyzed: rtsa rtse shing dang malli k'a //

analyzed: sha ta bh'i ru sa yi rkang //

analyzed: see ba spho t'a nags las byung //

analyzed: she ph'a li k'a legs 'bab dang // ni rgund'i dang sngon po can //

analyzed: si ta soo dang dkar po dang // ro zhim 'byung 'jug de nas ni //

analyzed: m'a ga dh'i dang ga ni k'a /

analyzed: y'u thi k'a& mbashth'a g'a b'i t'a he ma pushpi k'a //

analyzed: aa ti mukta ka: punda ka: sy'adb'a pant'i la t'a b'i la t'a //

analyzed: su ma n'a m'a la t'i dz'a ti: sapta l'a na ba m'a li k'a //

analyzed: m'a ghyam kundam rakta kastu bandh'u ko bam dhu dz'i ba ka: //

analyzed: sa h'a ku m'a r'i ta ra ni raml'a nastu yu thi k'a dang aamprashth'a //

original: de ser gser gyi me tog can /
analyzed: de ser gser gyi me tog can /

analyzed: shin tu grol dang punda ka / dpyid ldan sbrang gi shing 'khri shing //

analyzed: yid dga' sna ma dza' ti'o //
translated: the Sumana, the Malati, the Jati, the Saptachada, the Vamali,🔽the Magadha, the Kundamanda, the Raktaka, the Kastubandha, the Kovanthaka, the Jiva,🔽the Sahasra, the Kumari, the Tarani, the Ramalasa, the Yuthika, and the Amprastha.

original: 'dab bdun gzhon nu'i phreng ba can //
analyzed: 'dab bdun gzhon nu'i phreng ba can //

original: chu zla me tog kunda dang // dmar po me tog bandhu ka / bandhu dz'i ba ka yin no //
analyzed: chu zla me tog kunda dang // dmar po me tog bandhu ka / bandhu dz'i ba ka yin no //

analyzed: nus ldan gzhon nu ta ra ni // @159b ma h'a sa h'a //

original: ta tra so ne ku ru ba kasta tra p'i te ku runda ka: //
analyzed: ta tra so ne ku ru ba kasta tra p'i te ku runda ka: //

original: n'i la dzhind'i dva yorbb'a n'a d'a sh'i ts'artu ga la shtsa s'a //
analyzed: n'i la dzhind'i dva yorbb'a n'a d'a sh'i ts'artu ga la shtsa s'a //

analyzed: see r'i ya kastu dzhind'i sy'atta sminku ra ba ko ru ne //
translated: The two sārayakas are the two jhindis, the one with the kuruvaka,🔽the one with the kuruvaka, the jhindis, and the one with the sminkha, the two🔽hācāris.🔽The odra flower, the jaba flower, the vajra flower, the flower of the tilaka tree,

original: b'i t'a ku ra ba ko dzhind'i pa sminsa ha tsa r'i dva yo:/....(gnyis/) / ao dra pushpam dza b'a badzra pushpam pushpam ti la syata /
analyzed: b'i t'a ku ra ba ko dzhind'i pa sminsa ha tsa r'i dva yo:/....(gnyis/) / ao dra pushpam dza b'a badzra pushpam pushpam ti la syata /

original: aamla na dang nus ldan che //🔽de dmar ku ru ba ka'o //
analyzed: aamla na dang nus ldan che // de dmar ku ru ba ka'o //

original: de ser ku runda ka'o //
analyzed: de ser ku runda ka'o //

analyzed: sngon po dzhindi gnyis dang mda' // bran mo ts'a rtu ga la s'a //

original: see r'i ya ka dzhindi yin //
analyzed: see r'i ya ka dzhindi yin //

original: de dmar ku ra ba ka dang // ser po ku ra ba ka ni //
analyzed: de dmar ku ra ba ka dang // ser po ku ra ba ka ni //

original: dzhindi de dang lhan cig spyod //
analyzed: dzhindi de dang lhan cig spyod //

original: rnga mo me tog dza ba dang // rdo rje'i me tog me tog thig /
analyzed: rnga mo me tog dza ba dang // rdo rje'i me tog me tog thig /

analyzed: pra t'i h'a sa sha ta pr'a sa tsand'a ta ha ya m'a ra k'a: //

analyzed: aunma tta: ki ta bo dh'urtto dhu st'u ra ka na ka: hva ya: //

analyzed: m'a tu lo ma da na shts'a sya pha le m'a tu la pu tra ka: //

analyzed: pha la p'u ro b'i dza p'u re pra t'i h'a sa brgyar gyes dang // gtum po rta gsod lag pa dpa' //

analyzed: ka r'i ri dang kra ka ra //

analyzed: tshigs pa dang ni gnyi ga'o // smyo byed dang ni ki ta mo //

original: gdul dka' dang ni dhust'u ra //
analyzed: gdul dka' dang ni dhust'u ra //

analyzed: gser gyi me tog ces pa'o //

analyzed: m'a tu la dang myos byed do // de 'bras m'a tul pu tra ka / b'i dza p'u ra 'bras bus gang /

analyzed: tu tsa ko m'a tu lungga ke //

analyzed: sa m'i ra no ma ru ba ka:prastha pushpa:pa ni dzha ka / dzamb'i re pya tha parn'a se ka thinydza ra ku thi ra koo / si te& rdzdza ko& tra p'a th'i tu tsa tra ko ba hni sam dzany'a ka: //

analyzed: aark'a hva ba su k'a spo ta ga na r'u pa bi k'i ra n'a: //

analyzed: mand'a rashtsarka parnne& tra mdog mdzes m'a tu lungga ka // sa m'i ra na ma ru baka / pra stha me tog pha ni dzha ka / dzamb'i ra dang de nas ni //

original: parna se dang ka thinydza //
analyzed: parna se dang ka thinydza //

analyzed: ku thi ra ka dkar po dang // aa rdza ka 'dir p'a thi ni //

analyzed: tsi tra ka dang me'i ming can // aarka zhes pa ba su k'a //

analyzed: spho tsha tshogs gzugs rnam par 'thor // manda ra dang aarka'i 'dab /

original: @160a * // shukle& l rka ta pa soo //
analyzed: @160a * // shukle& l rka ta pa soo //

analyzed: shi ba mall'i p'a shu p'a ti ae k'ashthi lo ba ko ba su: //
translated: Shivapada, Ashthila, Lobha, Kopa,

analyzed: band'a briksh'a da n'i briksha ru h'a dz'i banti ke tya bi //

analyzed: bat+s'a da n'i tstshinna ru h'a gu d'u ts'i tantri k'a mri t'a //

original: dz'i bam ti k'a so ma ball'i bi sa ly'a * //
analyzed: dz'i bam ti k'a so ma ball'i bi sa ly'a * //

original: 'di dkar aa larka tas ba //
analyzed: 'di dkar aa larka tas ba //

original: zhi ba'i me tog phyugs bdag dga' //
analyzed: zhi ba'i me tog phyugs bdag dga' //

original: shing gcig spra ba ba su'a //
analyzed: shing gcig spra ba ba su'a //

original: band'a ....(hong len/) shing la za ba dang // shing skyes 'tsho byed nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: band'a ....(hong len/) shing la za ba dang // shing skyes 'tsho byed nyid kyang ngo //
translated: The one who eats the tree, and also the tree-born Jivaka.🔽The son who lives on fruit, the one who lives on sesame,

original: bu zas bcad skye sle tres dang // rgyud ldan bdud rtsi 'tsho byed dang // zla ba'i mgul pa yangs pa can //
analyzed: bu zas bcad skye sle tres dang // rgyud ldan bdud rtsi 'tsho byed dang // zla ba'i mgul pa yangs pa can //

original: sbrang ma dhu parnnya pi //
analyzed: sbrang ma dhu parnnya pi //
translated: The one with a wide throat,🔽The one who lives on smoke, the one who lives on honey,

original: m'urbb'a de b'i ma dhu ra s'a mo rat'a te dza n'i sru b'a //
analyzed: m'urbb'a de b'i ma dhu ra s'a mo rat'a te dza n'i sru b'a //

original: ma dh'u li k'a dha nu: shre n'i go parnn'i p'i lu parnnya pi //
analyzed: ma dh'u li k'a dha nu: shre n'i go parnn'i p'i lu parnnya pi //

original: p'a th'a mbashth'a bi dva karnn'i sth'a pa n'i shre ya sh'i ra s'a //
analyzed: p'a th'a mbashth'a bi dva karnn'i sth'a pa n'i shre ya sh'i ra s'a //

original: ai k'ashth'i l'a p'a pa tse l'i pr'a ts'i n'a ba na tikti k'a //
analyzed: ai k'ashth'i l'a p'a pa tse l'i pr'a ts'i n'a ba na tikti k'a //

original: ka tu ka dambha gi lo ma nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: ka tu ka dambha gi lo ma nyid kyang ngo //
translated: Katuka, Dāḍimā, and Giloyamūla.

original: m'urb'a lha mo sbrang gi ro //
analyzed: m'urb'a lha mo sbrang gi ro //
translated: Murvā is the goddess of honey,

original: mo ra ta dang 'od ldan thos //
analyzed: mo ra ta dang 'od ldan thos //
translated: Moratā and Prabhāvatī are heard.🔽Madhūlikā is the bow-string, Śṛṅgī is the leaf of the lotus,

original: ma dhu li ka gzhu shing dang // shri ni sa 'dab p'i lu'i 'dab //
analyzed: ma dhu li ka gzhu shing dang // shri ni sa 'dab p'i lu'i 'dab //

original: p'a th'a ma nu spos dkar dang // bi dva karni gnas can dang // rten dang ro ldan sdong bu gcig / sdig pa'i bran mo pr'a ts'i n'a //
analyzed: p'a th'a ma nu spos dkar dang // bi dva karni gnas can dang // rten dang ro ldan sdong bu gcig / sdig pa'i bran mo pr'a ts'i n'a //
translated: Katuka, Dāḍimā, and Giloyamūla.🔽Murvā is the goddess of honey,🔽Moratā and Prabhāvatī are heard.🔽Madhūlikā is the bow-string, Śṛṅgī is the leaf of the lotus,🔽Pāṭhā, Maṇḍūkaparṇī, Śatāvarī, Śvetā,🔽Ikṣvāku, Pāpācilī, Prācīnavānatikta,🔽Katuka, Dāḍimā, and Giloyamūla.

original: nags kyi ti sta tsha ba dang // tsha bas r'a& sho ka ro hi n'i ka tu ro hi n'i //
analyzed: nags kyi ti sta tsha ba dang // tsha bas r'a& sho ka ro hi n'i ka tu ro hi n'i //
translated: Murvā is the goddess of honey,🔽Moratā and Prabhāvatī are heard.

original: mat+sya bitt'a krishna bhe d'i tsakr'angg'i sha ku l'a da n'i //
analyzed: mat+sya bitt'a krishna bhe d'i tsakr'angg'i sha ku l'a da n'i //
translated: Madhūlikā is the bow-string, Śṛṅgī is the leaf of the lotus,🔽Pāṭhā, Maṇḍūkaparṇī, Śatāvarī, Śvetā,🔽Ikṣvāku, Pāpācilī, Prācīnavānatikta,🔽Katuka, Dāḍimā, and Giloyamūla.

original: a'atma gupt'a dza d'a& dhyand'a kandu r'a pr'a pri sh'a ya n'i //
analyzed: a'atma gupt'a dza d'a& dhyand'a kandu r'a pr'a pri sh'a ya n'i //
translated: Murvā is the goddess of honey

original: ri shya prokt'a sh'u ka shimbi: ka p'i katstsh'ushtsa markka t'i //🔽tsi tro pa tsi tr'an+ya gro dh'i dra bant'i sham ba gang dang mya ngan med //
analyzed: ri shya prokt'a sh'u ka shimbi: ka p'i katstsh'ushtsa markka t'i // tsi tro pa tsi tr'an+ya gro dh'i dra bant'i sham ba gang dang mya ngan med //
translated: Kapika, Katchusha, Charchita,🔽Chitrotpatika, Anyagrodhi, Dravanti, Shambhagam, and Ashoka.🔽Sphota, Tsphota, Nya, Pitta,

original: spor dang tsha spor nya mkhris dang // nag dbye 'khor lo'i yan lag dang // bya yi zas dang bdag sbed dang // dza d'a dang ni aa dhyanda //
analyzed: spor dang tsha spor nya mkhris dang // nag dbye 'khor lo'i yan lag dang // bya yi zas dang bdag sbed dang // dza d'a dang ni aa dhyanda //

original: g-ya' shing pr'a pri sh'a ya n'i //🔽ri shya prokt'a sh'u ka shimbi //

original: ke k'a b'a n'i ma y'u ra sya sa moo tsandra ka me tsa koo / shi kh'a ts'u d'a shi khanda stu pictsha barhe na pu sa ke / kha ge bi ham ga bi ha ga bi ham ga ma bi h'a ya sa: //🔽sha mgrin sngon dang ni lag 'gro za //

analyzed: pa tam tri pattri pa ta ga pa tatpa tra ra th'anda dz'a: //

analyzed: te sh'am bi she sho h'a gshog ldan nus ldan dang // sha kunta dang sha ku na //

analyzed: gnyis skyes 'dab ldan sgro can dang // pa tag dang pa tad dang // 'dab ma'i shing rta sgo nga skyes //

original: 'gro med la gnas srin bu za //
analyzed: 'gro med la gnas srin bu za //

original: bi sha ka re lo ma gsum //
analyzed: bi sha ka re lo ma gsum //

original: n'i dodbha ba 'dab ldan dang // pit+santa dang mkha' la spyod //
analyzed: n'i dodbha ba 'dab ldan dang // pit+santa dang mkha' la spyod //

original: de rnams bye brag @169a * //
analyzed: de rnams bye brag @169a * //

original: ri to ma d'u:k'a randa ba:pla ba: //
analyzed: ri to ma d'u:k'a randa ba:pla ba: //

original: titti ri:kukku bho l'a bo dz'i bam dz'i bashtsa ko ra ka:/....(zla 'od za lo/) / ko yashti kasht'i ti bha ko bartta ko bartti k'a da ya: //
analyzed: titti ri:kukku bho l'a bo dz'i bam dz'i bashtsa ko ra ka:/....(zla 'od za lo/) / ko yashti kasht'i ti bha ko bartta ko bartti k'a da ya: //

original: ga rutpa ksha tstsha d'a:ba tram pattram tsa ta n'u ru ham //
analyzed: ga rutpa ksha tstsha d'a:ba tram pattram tsa ta n'u ru ham //

original: str'i paksha ti:baksha m'u lam tsanytsustro ti ru bhe * //
analyzed: str'i paksha ti:baksha m'u lam tsanytsustro ti ru bhe * //
translated: Satri paksha-ti, baksha mulan chachushta roti ruve.🔽Green, many, goer, mango, parrot, partridge, peacock,

original: ljang kha dang // mang gu 'gro byed zam tog / sreg pa phyogs dgod lta ba dang // shang shang te'u tsa ko ra //
analyzed: ljang kha dang // mang gu 'gro byed zam tog / sreg pa phyogs dgod lta ba dang // shang shang te'u tsa ko ra //
translated: crane, swan, cuckoo, and so on.

original: ko yashti kasht'i ti bha //
analyzed: ko yashti kasht'i ti bha //
translated: Ko yashta kshta-ti bhava.

original: warta wa rti ka sogs so //
analyzed: warta wa rti ka sogs so //
translated: Varta vartika, and so on.

original: bya spu gshog pa sgro dang ni //🔽'gebs byed lo ma lus skyes so //🔽mo ni dpung pa gshog rtsa'o //
analyzed: bya spu gshog pa sgro dang ni // 'gebs byed lo ma lus skyes so // mo ni dpung pa gshog rtsa'o //
translated: Bird feathers are wings, and🔽the covering is leaves.🔽The female has shoulders and wing joints.

original: mchu dang gdong stri y'am //
analyzed: mchu dang gdong stri y'am //
translated: The beak and face are striya.

original: pra d'i nottr'i na sam d'i n'a n+ye t'a:kha ga ga ti kri y'a: //
analyzed: pra d'i nottr'i na sam d'i n'a n+ye t'a:kha ga ga ti kri y'a: //
translated: Pradi, nottri, sandi, anyetah, khagagati kriya.

original: pe n'i ko sho dvi h'i nenyandam ku l'a yo n'i da ma stri y'am //
analyzed: pe n'i ko sho dvi h'i nenyandam ku l'a yo n'i da ma stri y'am //
translated: Penika, kosh, dvi, hani, andama kula, ayona striya.

original: po ta:p'a konyarbha ko dimbha:pri thu ka:sh'a ba ka:shi shu: //
analyzed: po ta:p'a konyarbha ko dimbha:pri thu ka:sh'a ba ka:shi shu: //
translated: Pot, pak, kounar, bhaka, koda, dimbha, prithuka, shavaka, shishu.

original: str'i pum soo mi thu nam dvam dvam tu yugmam yu ga lam pa gnyis mo'o //
analyzed: str'i pum soo mi thu nam dvam dvam tu yugmam yu ga lam pa gnyis mo'o //
translated: Satri pumso, mi thunan, dvam dvam, tu yugman, yugma, lamap.

original: gyen du 'phur dang thur du 'phur //
analyzed: gyen du 'phur dang thur du 'phur //
translated: Urdhvam, utpatana, adho, patana,

original: thang 'phur de rnams mkha' la byed //
analyzed: thang 'phur de rnams mkha' la byed //
translated: khanga, patana, te, khagaviha.

original: sbubs dang mdzod dang sgo nga'o //
analyzed: sbubs dang mdzod dang sgo nga'o //
translated: Egg, treasure, door, and womb.

original: bya tshang n'i da mo min no //
analyzed: bya tshang n'i da mo min no //
translated: The nest is not the mother.

original: phru gu bu tsha aarba ka / bu phrug dang ni pri thu ka / gsar skyes shi shu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phru gu bu tsha aarba ka / bu phrug dang ni pri thu ka / gsar skyes shi shu zhes bya'o //
translated: The young, the offspring, the Arvaka, the son, the child, and the Prithuka, are called the newborn.

original: pho mo 'dus dang 'khrig pa dang // gnyis gnyis zung dang yu gam //
analyzed: pho mo 'dus dang 'khrig pa dang // gnyis gnyis zung dang yu gam //
translated: The union of male and female, copulation, the two pairs, and the Yugma.

original: sa m'u ha ni ba ha by'u ha sando ha bi sa ra bra dz'a: //
analyzed: sa m'u ha ni ba ha by'u ha sando ha bi sa ra bra dz'a: //
translated: Samuha, Vaha, Samdoha, Visara, and Praja.

original: sto moo gha ni ka ra br'a ta b'a ra sam gh'a ta panytsa y'a: //
analyzed: sto moo gha ni ka ra br'a ta b'a ra sam gh'a ta panytsa y'a: //
translated: Stoma, Mogha, Karavrata, Varsa, Sanghata, and Panchaya.

original: sa mu d'a ya sa mu da ya: sa ma b'a yashtsa yo ga na: //
analyzed: sa mu d'a ya sa mu da ya: sa ma b'a yashtsa yo ga na: //
translated: Samudaya, Samudaya, Samava, and Yash, together.

original: stri yantu sam ha ti brindanni ku rumbam ka damba kam //🔽brinda bhe d'a:sa merbbargga:sam dor yu gam / tshogs pa 'dus pa phung po dang // san do ha dang bi sa ra //🔽tshogs pa 'phungs pa dang ni 'dus //🔽br'a ta b'a ra ni ka ra //🔽sa mu da ya 'dus legs bsags //
analyzed: stri yantu sam ha ti brindanni ku rumbam ka damba kam // brinda bhe d'a:sa merbbargga:sam dor yu gam / tshogs pa 'dus pa phung po dang // san do ha dang bi sa ra // tshogs pa 'phungs pa dang ni 'dus // br'a ta b'a ra ni ka ra // sa mu da ya 'dus legs bsags //
translated: Striyantu, Samhati, Brindana, Nikurma, Kadamba, and Kadam.

original: sa ma b'a ya bsags pa tshogs //
analyzed: sa ma b'a ya bsags pa tshogs //
translated: Brindabheda, Same, Merubhraga, Sandora, and Yugma.

original: sam ha ti dang brinda'o //
analyzed: sam ha ti dang brinda'o //
translated: Samādhi and Dṛndha.

original: ni ku rumba ka damba kam //
analyzed: ni ku rumba ka damba kam //
translated: Nikuru, mva, ka, and dampaka.

original: de rnams tshogs pa'i dbye ba ste //🔽tshogs pa'i @169b gha s'a rtho tu dzantu bhi: //🔽sa dz'a t'i yee: ku lam y'u tham ti rashts'am punna punsa kam //🔽pa sh'u n'am sa ma dzonyan+ye sh'am sa m'a dzenyatha sa dharmi nam //🔽sy'anni k'a ya: sum dza r'a sh'i t'utka ra: k'u ta mastri y'am //🔽rnam grangs sde tshan mtshungs //
analyzed: de rnams tshogs pa'i dbye ba ste // tshogs pa'i @169b gha s'a rtho tu dzantu bhi: // sa dz'a t'i yee: ku lam y'u tham ti rashts'am punna punsa kam // pa sh'u n'am sa ma dzonyan+ye sh'am sa m'a dzenyatha sa dharmi nam // sy'anni k'a ya: sum dza r'a sh'i t'utka ra: k'u ta mastri y'am // rnam grangs sde tshan mtshungs //
translated: These are the divisions of the groups.

original: dge 'dun lhan cig skye bo 'dus //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhan cig skye bo 'dus //
translated: The group is called saṃgha, because it is a gathering of many people.🔽The saṃgha is of four kinds: the saṃgha of the noble ones, the saṃgha of the Buddha, the saṃgha of the Dharma, and the saṃgha of the assembly.

original: de yi rigs dang mtshungs pa dang // dud 'gro khyu dang tshan pa ste //🔽skyes bu dang ni ma ning ngo //
analyzed: de yi rigs dang mtshungs pa dang // dud 'gro khyu dang tshan pa ste // skyes bu dang ni ma ning ngo //
translated: The saṃgha of the noble ones is of two kinds: the saṃgha of the noble ones who are not fully ordained, and the saṃgha of the noble ones who are fully ordained.

original: dud 'gro rnams kyi mtshungs pa'o //🔽gzhan rnams kyi ni sa m'a dza //
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams kyi mtshungs pa'o // gzhan rnams kyi ni sa m'a dza //
translated: The saṃgha of the Buddha is of three kinds: the saṃgha of the Buddha who is a human, the saṃgha of the Buddha who is a non-human, and the saṃgha of the Buddha who is neither human nor non-human.

original: chos mtshungs rnams la ni k'a ya //
analyzed: chos mtshungs rnams la ni k'a ya //
translated: The saṃgha of the Dharma is of two kinds: the saṃgha of the Dharma that is a collection, and the saṃgha of the Dharma that is a heap.🔽The saṃgha of the assembly is of four kinds: the saṃgha of the assembly of humans, the saṃgha of the assembly of non-humans, the saṃgha of the assembly of both humans and non-humans, and the saṃgha of the assembly of neither humans nor non-humans.🔽The saṃgha of the assembly of humans is of two kinds: the saṃgha of the assembly of humans who are fully ordained, and the saṃgha of the assembly of humans who are not fully ordained.🔽The saṃgha of the assembly of non-humans is of three kinds: the saṃgha of the assembly of non-humans who are animals, the saṃgha of the assembly of non-humans who are ghosts, and the saṃgha of the assembly of non-humans who are gods.

original: phung po spungs pa byur bu k'a po ta shoo ka m'a y'u ra teetti r'a d'i ni tam ga ne //
analyzed: phung po spungs pa byur bu k'a po ta shoo ka m'a y'u ra teetti r'a d'i ni tam ga ne //
translated: The saṃgha of the assembly of both humans and non-humans is of four kinds: the saṃgha of the assembly of both humans and non-humans who are fully ordained, the saṃgha of the assembly of both humans and non-humans who are not fully ordained, the saṃgha of the assembly of both humans and non-humans who are neither fully ordained nor not fully ordained, and the saṃgha of the assembly of both humans and non-humans who are neither fully ordained nor not fully ordained.

original: gri h'a sakt'a:pakshi mri g'ashtshe kaste gri hya k'ashtsa te //🔽sim h'a di bargga://🔽` // ma nu shy'a m'a nu sh'a marty'a ma nu sh'a marty'a ma nu dz'a ma n'a b'a na ra: //🔽syu:pu m'ansa:panytsa dza n+ya:pu ru sh'a: dang // brtsegs pa mo min phug ron khyu //🔽ne tso'i khyu sogs 'tshogs pa'o //🔽khyim chags bya dang ri dags rnams //🔽tshi ka de rnams khyim gnas so //
analyzed: gri h'a sakt'a:pakshi mri g'ashtshe kaste gri hya k'ashtsa te // sim h'a di bargga:// ` // ma nu shy'a m'a nu sh'a marty'a ma nu sh'a marty'a ma nu dz'a ma n'a b'a na ra: // syu:pu m'ansa:panytsa dza n+ya:pu ru sh'a: dang // brtsegs pa mo min phug ron khyu // ne tso'i khyu sogs 'tshogs pa'o // khyim chags bya dang ri dags rnams // tshi ka de rnams khyim gnas so //

original: seng ge la sogs pa'i sde'o//
analyzed: seng ge la sogs pa'i sde'o//

analyzed: shin tu @170a * //
translated: The one who is very

original: m'at'a pi ta roo pi ta roo m'a ta ra pi ta roo tsa t'a ta bu bho dza na pi tyoo //🔽shva shru shva shu roo shva shu roo bu troo pu trashtsa du hi t'a tsa //
analyzed: m'at'a pi ta roo pi ta roo m'a ta ra pi ta roo tsa t'a ta bu bho dza na pi tyoo // shva shru shva shu roo shva shu roo bu troo pu trashtsa du hi t'a tsa //
translated: The mother, the father, the father-in-law, the brother-in-law, the son, the son-in-law, the daughter, the wife, are the same.

original: dampa t'i dzampa rnams ni mtshungs pa'o //🔽khyo ma shi yi rtsa lag skyes //
analyzed: dampa t'i dzampa rnams ni mtshungs pa'o // khyo ma shi yi rtsa lag skyes //
translated: The good, the bad, the good-looking, the ugly, the son, the daughter, the friend, the enemy, are the same.🔽The rich, the poor, the famous, the unknown, the wise, the foolish, the good, the bad, are the same.🔽The husband, the son-in-law, the brother-in-law, the father-in-law, the friend, the son, are the same.

original: kundo ma shi gso go la //
analyzed: kundo ma shi gso go la //
translated: The husband, the son-in-law, the brother-in-law, the father-in-law, the friend, the son, are the same.

original: sring mo lcam mo las skyes dang // spun zla sring mo spun dag gnyis //
analyzed: sring mo lcam mo las skyes dang // spun zla sring mo spun dag gnyis //

original: pha ma dag ni pi ta roo //

original: bu dang bu mo'ang bu dag go //
analyzed: bu dang bu mo'ang bu dag go //

original: bza' mi khyo shug khyim thab dang / t'i bh'ar++y'a pa t'i dza y'a pa t'i tsa too //

analyzed: gsher byed rlan byed mo ma yin //

original: lo tsa nam na ya nam ne tra mi ksha nam tsakshu byed snyoms byed so //🔽t'a lu zhes pa dkan yin no //🔽ro shes ro myang lce yin no //🔽mchu yi mtha' ma kha yi gru //🔽dpral ba rgyan gnas mig 'dzin dang // mig steng smin ma dag ni mo //

translated: The tongue is called loṭana, and the eyes are called nāḍī.🔽The palate is called tālu.🔽The lips are called oṣṭha.🔽The corners of the mouth are called koṇṭha.🔽The eyebrows are called bhrū, and the eyes are called akṣi.🔽

original: mchi ma mig chu ngus byung dang // aa sra dang ni mchi ma'o //
analyzed: mchi ma mig chu ngus byung dang // aa sra dang ni mchi ma'o //
translated: Tears are the water of the eyes, and the tears that flow from grief.

original: aa s'adgo ni mig mtha' dang // zur mig dang ni yon por lta //
analyzed: aa s'adgo ni mig mtha' dang // zur mig dang ni yon por lta //
translated: The corners of the eyes are called asrag, and the sidelong glance is called kuṭṭima.

original: rna ba sgra 'dzin skyes bu dang // mo ni thos byed nyan byed snyan //
analyzed: rna ba sgra 'dzin skyes bu dang // mo ni thos byed nyan byed snyan //
translated: The ear is called śrotra, and the person who hears is called śrotṛ.

original: yan lag mchog dang mgo m'urdha n'a masta konyastri y'am //
analyzed: yan lag mchog dang mgo m'urdha n'a masta konyastri y'am //
translated: The head is called mūrdhan, and the top of the head is called mastaka.

original: tsi ku ra: kunta lo b'a la: ka tsa: ke sha shi ro ru ha: //
analyzed: tsi ku ra: kunta lo b'a la: ka tsa: ke sha shi ro ru ha: //
translated: The hair is called keśa, and the head is called śiras.🔽The eyebrows are called bhrū, and the eyelashes are called aṅganā.🔽The forehead is called lalāṭa, and the cheeks are called kapota.🔽The nose is called nāsikā, and the nostrils are called nāsā.🔽The mouth is called vaktra, and the lips are called oṣṭha.🔽The teeth are called danta, and the tongue is called jihvā.

original: tadbrinde ke shi kam kee shya ma la k'ashts'urna kunda l'a: //
analyzed: tadbrinde ke shi kam kee shya ma la k'ashts'urna kunda l'a: //
translated: The throat is called kaṇṭha, and the neck is called grīvā.🔽The shoulder is called skandha, and the arm is called bāhu.🔽The elbow is called arśa, and the forearm is called mṛga.🔽The wrist is called śrīśaila, and the hand is called hasta.🔽The fingers are called aṅguli, and the nails are called nakha.

original: te la l'a te bhra ma ra k'a: k'a ka paksha: si khanda ka: //
analyzed: te la l'a te bhra ma ra k'a: k'a ka paksha: si khanda ka: //
translated: The back of the hand is called pāṇitala, and the palm is called pāṇitala.🔽The chest is called uras, and the heart is called hṛdaya.🔽The navel is called nābhi, and the belly is called udara.🔽The buttocks are called śroṇi, and the thighs are called ūru.🔽The knees are called jānu, and the calves are called gū.

original: ka ba r'i ke sha pe sonyatham milla: bo dang // dbu dang steng dang masta ka / mo min slar skye 'khyil pa skra //
analyzed: ka ba r'i ke sha pe sonyatham milla: bo dang // dbu dang steng dang masta ka / mo min slar skye 'khyil pa skra //
translated: The feet are called pādau, and the toes are called aṅgulī.

original: skra dang ke sha mgo skyes dang // tshogs pa skra ldan kee sha ka / rgyan dang skra lo 'khyil pa dang // de rnams dpral ba'i bung ba dang // bya rog gshog dang gtsug phud can //
analyzed: skra dang ke sha mgo skyes dang // tshogs pa skra ldan kee sha ka / rgyan dang skra lo 'khyil pa dang // de rnams dpral ba'i bung ba dang // bya rog gshog dang gtsug phud can //
translated: Ornament, curly hair, and lock of hair, are the same as forehead.🔽Crow-wing, and top-knot, are the same as crest.

original: skra bcings pa dang skra tshugs dang // de nas me tog tvam sam pa t'a: ku ts'a: //
analyzed: skra bcings pa dang skra tshugs dang // de nas me tog tvam sam pa t'a: ku ts'a: //
translated: Hair-band, and hair-style, are the same as flower.🔽Tvam sampatas, and kucas, are the same as sky.

original: si kh'a ts'u da ke sha p'a sh'i bra ti nastu pa ta dza t'a //🔽be ni: pra be n'i sh'irsha nya shir syoo bi sha de ka tse //
analyzed: si kh'a ts'u da ke sha p'a sh'i bra ti nastu pa ta dza t'a // be ni: pra be n'i sh'irsha nya shir syoo bi sha de ka tse //
translated: Cudas, and kesapasa, are the same as braid.

original: p'a sha: pakshashtsa hastashtsa ka l'a parth'a: ka ts'atpa re //
analyzed: p'a sha: pakshashtsa hastashtsa ka l'a parth'a: ka ts'atpa re //
translated: Pasas, and paksa-hastacchakalas, are the same as armlet.

original: ta n'u ru ham ro ma lo mam tadbrirdhoosma sru bcangs pa dang // sa pa ta: ka ca zhes so //🔽thor tshugs gtsug pud skra bcings so //🔽brtul zhugs ral pa dza t'a'o //🔽lan bu skra lan skra lhas ma //🔽ral pa ka tsa bi sha de //
analyzed: ta n'u ru ham ro ma lo mam tadbrirdhoosma sru bcangs pa dang // sa pa ta: ka ca zhes so //🔽thor tshugs gtsug pud skra bcings so //🔽brtul zhugs ral pa dza t'a'o //🔽lan bu skra lan skra lhas ma //🔽ral pa ka tsa bi sha de //
translated: Tanuruha, and romaloman, are the same as beard.

original: p'a sha paksha hasta dang // ka l'a p'artha de rnams ni //
analyzed: p'a sha paksha hasta dang // ka l'a p'artha de rnams ni //
translated: Kalāpartha, these are the

original: ka tsa'i pha rol skra tshogs yin //
analyzed: ka tsa'i pha rol skra tshogs yin //
translated: hair-bundles beyond the Kaca.

original: las skyes spu dang ba spu'o //
analyzed: las skyes spu dang ba spu'o //
translated: Hair and body hair are born from action.

original: da rgan @177b pum mu khe //🔽a'a kalpa be thoo ne pa thyam pra ti karmma pra s'a dha nam //🔽da shee te tri shva lam ka natt'anyalam ka rishnashtsa manda na: //🔽pra s'a dhi tonyalam kri tashtsa bh'u shi tashtsa pa riskra ta: //🔽bi bhr'adbhr'a dzishna ro tsishn'u bh'u sh'a tu sy'a da lam kri y'a //🔽aa lam k'a rast'a smar kha la'o //🔽mdzes bcos rgyan bcings ne pa thyam //

analyzed: h'a ro mukt'a ba li de ba tstshando nyasho sha ta ya sti ka: //

original: br'a lam bi ka gser do shal //
analyzed: br'a lam bi ka gser do shal //

original: ke y'u ra mangga dam tu lye aam gu l'i ya ka m'urmmi k'a //
analyzed: ke y'u ra mangga dam tu lye aam gu l'i ya ka m'urmmi k'a //
translated: Keyūra, armlet, Amuṣṇīṣa, and Gulika.

original: * // drug cu rtsa gnyis gun sa'o //
analyzed: * // drug cu rtsa gnyis gun sa'o //
translated: Sixty-two are Gunas.

original: do shal phyed pa drug cu bzhi //
analyzed: do shal phyed pa drug cu bzhi //
translated: Half-necklaces are sixty-four.

original: phreng ba gcig pa yashti k'a //
analyzed: phreng ba gcig pa yashti k'a //
translated: A single garland is Yaṣṭika.

original: rgyu skar phreng ba se mo do //
analyzed: rgyu skar phreng ba se mo do //
translated: The constellation garland is Semodaka.

original: mu tig nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: mu tig nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
translated: Twenty-seven are pearls.

original: gdu bu lag gdub ka ta kam //
analyzed: gdu bu lag gdub ka ta kam //
translated: Bracelets and anklets are Kataṃka.

original: ba la ya ni mo min no //
analyzed: ba la ya ni mo min no //
translated: Valaya is not a female.

original: ke y'u ra ni dpung rgyan mtshungs //
analyzed: ke y'u ra ni dpung rgyan mtshungs //
translated: Keyūra is an equal armlet.

original: aam gu li ya sor gdub bo //
analyzed: aam gu li ya sor gdub bo //
translated: Amuṣṇīṣa is a finger ring.

original: s'a ksha r'adgu li mu dr'a s'a kam ka nam ka ra bh'u sha nam //
analyzed: s'a ksha r'adgu li mu dr'a s'a kam ka nam ka ra bh'u sha nam //
translated: Sākaṣa, armlet, garland, and Sākaṃka, earrings, and Karabhūṣaṇa.

original: stri ka ty'a me kha l'a k'anyts'i sapta k'i ra sha n'a ta th'a //
analyzed: stri ka ty'a me kha l'a k'anyts'i sapta k'i ra sha n'a ta th'a //
translated: Trikaṭyā, Mekhalā, Kañcuka, Saptaka, and Śanāṭa.

original: kl'i be s'a ra sha nam tsa tha pumska ty'am shrim kha l'a tri shu //
analyzed: kl'i be s'a ra sha nam tsa tha pumska ty'am shrim kha l'a tri shu //
translated: Kalaviṅka, Sāraṅga, Śaṃkha, Catra, Pūkaṭyā, Śrīkhalā, Triśūla.

original: b'a d'angga dantu l'a ko tirmmanydz'i ro n'u pu ronyastri y'am //
analyzed: b'a d'angga dantu l'a ko tirmmanydz'i ro n'u pu ronyastri y'am //
translated: Vāṅga, Dantī, Ulūkhalī, and Mṛṇāḷī, Rūpa, and Pūrṇā, Triyā.

original: hansa ka: p'a da ka yi ge'i sor gdub rgya ldan yin //🔽gser gyi lag gdub kam ka nam //
analyzed: hansa ka: p'a da ka yi ge'i sor gdub rgya ldan yin //🔽gser gyi lag gdub kam ka nam //
translated: Haṃsa, Pāda, and Kaṭi.

original: bud med rked rgyan 'og pag go //🔽gser ska bdun pa rked rgyan dang // de bzhin ma ning rked rgyan min //
analyzed: bud med rked rgyan 'og pag go // gser ska bdun pa rked rgyan dang // de bzhin ma ning rked rgyan min //
translated: The girdle of a woman is called ograbaka.🔽The girdle of a man is called suvarna-saptanga.🔽Then, the girdle of a neuter is called naubandhana.

original: de nas skyes bu rked pa yi //
analyzed: de nas skyes bu rked pa yi //
translated: The anklet is called nūpura.🔽The foot ornament is called pāda-bhūṣaṇa.

original: rkang gdub zhabs gdub manydz'i ro //🔽n'u pu ra ni mo min no //
analyzed: rkang gdub zhabs gdub manydz'i ro // n'u pu ra ni mo min no //
translated: The ankle ornament is called kaṅkaṇa.

original: ngang pa can dang rkang rgyan no //

original: shr'i ba so bri ka dh'u po shr'i pishta sha ra la dra boo //
analyzed: shr'i ba so bri ka dh'u po shr'i pishta sha ra la dra boo //
translated: Sreevasa, trikadhupa, sreevishta, sharala, drava,

original: dri dang ni //
analyzed: dri dang ni //
translated: And fragrance.

original: mchod sbyin spos dang pra rtsi shing //
analyzed: mchod sbyin spos dang pra rtsi shing //
translated: Sacrifice, incense, pratsina wood,🔽White sandalwood paste, all combined, and then

original: spos dkar khu ba kun ldan dang // gzugs mang po dang de nas ni //
analyzed: spos dkar khu ba kun ldan dang // gzugs mang po dang de nas ni //
translated: Many forms, and then

original: bri ka dh'u pa sbyar spos so //
analyzed: bri ka dh'u pa sbyar spos so //
translated: Trikadhupa, combined incense.

original: tu ru ska dang pandi ka //
analyzed: tu ru ska dang pandi ka //
translated: Turuska, pandika,

original: si hla p'a ba na yang ngo //
analyzed: si hla p'a ba na yang ngo //
translated: Sihla, avana,

original: de nas p'a ya sha dang ni //
analyzed: de nas p'a ya sha dang ni //
translated: And then payasha,

original: dpal gos bri ka dh'u pa dang // shr'i pishta dang thang chu'o //
analyzed: dpal gos bri ka dh'u pa dang // shr'i pishta dang thang chu'o //

original: mri ga n'a bhi rmri ga ma da: kast'u r'i ts'a tha ko la kam //
analyzed: mri ga n'a bhi rmri ga ma da: kast'u r'i ts'a tha ko la kam //

original: kakko la kam ko sha pha la ma tha karp'u ra mastri y'am //
analyzed: kakko la kam ko sha pha la ma tha karp'u ra mastri y'am //
translated: Kakkolaka, koshaphala, matha, karpura, mastaki,

original: gha na s'a rashtsam dra sam dznya: si t'a bhro hi ma b'a lu k'a //
analyzed: gha na s'a rashtsam dra sam dznya: si t'a bhro hi ma b'a lu k'a //
translated: Ghanasarascha, samjna, sita, bhrorhi, mavaluka,🔽And so on.

original: gandha s'a ro ma la ya dze bha drashr'ishtsa nda no & stri y'am //
analyzed: gandha s'a ro ma la ya dze bha drashr'ishtsa nda no & stri y'am //

analyzed: tel parnni ka go sh'irsho ha ri dvags lte ba ri dvags chang //
translated: Tela, Parnini, Goshirsha, Hari, Mriga, Lamba, Mriga, Madhu,

original: gla rtsi de nas ko la kam //
analyzed: gla rtsi de nas ko la kam //

original: kakko la dang spubs kyi 'bras //
analyzed: kakko la dang spubs kyi 'bras //

original: de nas ga pur mo min no //
analyzed: de nas ga pur mo min no //
translated: Then, Kapur, Momina,

original: gha na'i snying po zla ba'i ming //
analyzed: gha na'i snying po zla ba'i ming //
translated: Ghani, Hridaya, and Chandramas,

original: 'od dkar kha ba'i bye ma'o //
analyzed: 'od dkar kha ba'i bye ma'o //

original: dri snying ma la ya skyes dang // bzang dpal tsandan mo min no //
analyzed: dri snying ma la ya skyes dang // bzang dpal tsandan mo min no //

original: te la parnni sa mchog dang // @180a * //
analyzed: te la parnni sa mchog dang // @180a * //
translated: Tela, Parnini, the best,

original: rishtsanda na ma stri y'am //
analyzed: rishtsanda na ma stri y'am //
translated: Rishi, Chandana, and Matrka,

original: ti la parnn'i tu pa tr'a nggam ranydza n'am rakta tsanda nam //
analyzed: ti la parnn'i tu pa tr'a nggam ranydza n'am rakta tsanda nam //
translated: Tela, Parnini, Tupatra, Anga, Rajani, Rakta, Chandana,

original: ku tsanda nanyts'a tha dza ti ke sh'a dz'a ti pha le sa me //
analyzed: ku tsanda nanyts'a tha dza ti ke sh'a dz'a ti pha le sa me //
translated: Kucandana, Chatra, Jati, Kesha, Jati, Phala, and Sama,

original: karp'u r'a gu ru kast'u r'i kakko leer++ya ksha mardda ma: //
analyzed: karp'u r'a gu ru kast'u r'i kakko leer++ya ksha mardda ma: //
translated: Karpura, Guru, Kasturi, Kakkola, and Yakshma-hradam,

original: g'a tr'a nu le pa n'i bartti barnna kam sy'a dbi le pa nam /
analyzed: g'a tr'a nu le pa n'i bartti barnna kam sy'a dbi le pa nam /

original: * // ha ri tsandan mo ma yin //
analyzed: * // ha ri tsandan mo ma yin //
translated: Hari, Chandana, Momina,

original: til barnn'i pa tr'angga //
analyzed: til barnn'i pa tr'angga //
translated: Tilaparna, and Patra.

original: chos byed tsandan dmar po'o //
analyzed: chos byed tsandan dmar po'o //
translated: The red sandalwood is for the Dharma practitioner.

original: tsandan ngan pa de nas ni //
analyzed: tsandan ngan pa de nas ni //
translated: The inferior sandalwood is for the next.

original: dz'a ti spubs skyes 'bras bu mnyam //
analyzed: dz'a ti spubs skyes 'bras bu mnyam //
translated: The fruit of Jati is equal.

original: ga pur gla rtsi aa ka ru //
analyzed: ga pur gla rtsi aa ka ru //
translated: Camphor, musk, and agarwood,

original: kakkol rnams mchod sbyin spos //
analyzed: kakkol rnams mchod sbyin spos //
translated: Kakkola are the incense for the sacrifice.

original: lus kyi byug pa brti'o //
analyzed: lus kyi byug pa brti'o //
translated: The body is anointed with unguents.

original: barna kam ni kha dog byug /
analyzed: barna kam ni kha dog byug /
translated: Varna is the color anointing.

original: ts'urnn'a ni b'a sa yo g'a:syurbh'a bi tam ba si tam tri shu //
analyzed: ts'urnn'a ni b'a sa yo g'a:syurbh'a bi tam ba si tam tri shu //
translated: Cūrṇanā, vāsya, yoga, syur bhavitaṃ vapasi, triṣu.

original: sam sk'a ro gandha m'a ly'a dyer++ya:sy'a tta da dhi ba sa nam //
analyzed: sam sk'a ro gandha m'a ly'a dyer++ya:sy'a tta da dhi ba sa nam //
translated: Saṃskāra, roga, gandha, mālya, dyair yaḥ syāt tat-tad-dhi-vasanam.

original: m'a lyam m'a l'a shra dzoo m'urdhni ke sha ma dhye tu garbha ka: //
analyzed: m'a lyam m'a l'a shra dzoo m'urdhni ke sha ma dhye tu garbha ka: //
translated: Mālyaṃ, māla, śrajo, mūr-dhni, keśa, madhye, tu, garbhakaḥ.

original: pra bhashta kam shi kh'a lambi pu ro n+ya stam la l'a pa kam //🔽pr'a lamba mri dzu lamba phye ma gos dang sbyar ba dang // dri 'dzin gos ni gsum yin no //🔽dri dang phreng sogs legs sbyar gos //🔽lhag pa'i gos dang me tog phreng //🔽me tog phreng ba spyi bo'i steng //
analyzed: pra bhashta kam shi kh'a lambi pu ro n+ya stam la l'a pa kam //🔽pr'a lamba mri dzu lamba phye ma gos dang sbyar ba dang // dri 'dzin gos ni gsum yin no //🔽dri dang phreng sogs legs sbyar gos //🔽lhag pa'i gos dang me tog phreng //🔽me tog phreng ba spyi bo'i steng //
translated: Prabhāṣṭa, kaṃ, śikha, ālambi, puro, nyastaṃ, lavalāpakaṃ.

original: skra yi dbus su garbha ka //
analyzed: skra yi dbus su garbha ka //
translated: In the middle of the hair, the garbhaka.

original: steng du 'phyang dang rtse mo 'phyang //
analyzed: steng du 'phyang dang rtse mo 'phyang //
translated: Hanging above, hanging at the tip,

original: mdun du la l'a pa kam po //
analyzed: mdun du la l'a pa kam po //
translated: in front, the lavalapaka.

original: rab 'phyang drag po mgul du sy'atkanth'a dvee kaksha kam tu tata //🔽yattir++yakkshipta mu ra shi si kh'a sv'a p'i da shi kha roo //
analyzed: rab 'phyang drag po mgul du sy'atkanth'a dvee kaksha kam tu tata // yattir++yakkshipta mu ra shi si kh'a sv'a p'i da shi kha roo //
translated: Hanging down, the raudrakandha, the single-eyed one, the terrible.🔽When the terrible one throws the garland of skulls,🔽the sky is filled with his laughter.

original: ra tsa n'a sy'atpa ri syanda a'a bho ga: pa ri p'urnna t'a //
analyzed: ra tsa n'a sy'atpa ri syanda a'a bho ga: pa ri p'urnna t'a //
translated: The racanasa is the beginning of the adornment, the complete.

original: au pa dh'a nam t'u ba barha: sa yy'am y'a sha ya n'i ya ba ta //
analyzed: au pa dh'a nam t'u ba barha: sa yy'am y'a sha ya n'i ya ba ta //
translated: The upadhana is the bed, the bed of the one who has desire.

original: sha ya nam manytsa par++yam ka pa lyangg'a: kha tva y'a sa 'phyang //🔽me tog ga shal se ral kha //
analyzed: sha ya nam manytsa par++yam ka pa lyangg'a: kha tva y'a sa 'phyang // me tog ga shal se ral kha //
translated: The shayana is the bed, the bed with the pillow.

original: gang zhig 'phreng bcings brang la'o //🔽shi kh'a sva ni spyi bor bzhag / bkod pa dang ni chas rtsom pa //
analyzed: gang zhig 'phreng bcings brang la'o // shi kh'a sva ni spyi bor bzhag / bkod pa dang ni chas rtsom pa //
translated: The flower garland is worn on the chest.🔽The shikhasva is placed on the head.

original: aa bho ga ni yongs su rdzogs //🔽au pa dh'a nam rgyas yin no //
analyzed: aa bho ga ni yongs su rdzogs // au pa dh'a nam rgyas yin no //
translated: The abhoga is the beginning of the arrangement, the complete.🔽The upadhana is the bed, the bed of the one who has desire.

original: nyal ba gzims pa sha ya n'i //
analyzed: nyal ba gzims pa sha ya n'i //
translated: The shayana is the bed, the bed with the pillow.

original: khri dang nyal khri gzims khri dang // kha tva ya ni mtshungs @180b m'a: //🔽gendu ka:kandu ko d'i pa:pra d'i pa:b'i tha m'a sa ni //🔽sa mungga ka:sam pu ta ka: pra ti gr'a ha:ba tam gra ha: //🔽pra s'a dha n'i kam ka ti k'a pisht'a ta:phat b'a shi k'a: //🔽darpa ne ma ku r'a darshoo bya dza nanta la brinda kam //
analyzed: khri dang nyal khri gzims khri dang // kha tva ya ni mtshungs @180b m'a: // gendu ka:kandu ko d'i pa:pra d'i pa:b'i tha m'a sa ni // sa mungga ka:sam pu ta ka: pra ti gr'a ha:ba tam gra ha: // pra s'a dha n'i kam ka ti k'a pisht'a ta:phat b'a shi k'a: // darpa ne ma ku r'a darshoo bya dza nanta la brinda kam //
translated: thrones, couches, and beds,🔽katavas, and yatavas,🔽gandukas, kandukas, and pradakas,🔽samugakas, samputakas, pratigrakas, and vatagrakas,🔽prasadhanikas, kamkatikas, and pishtas,🔽and patavashis.🔽In the presence of the king, they were seen to be like the gods.

original: pa'o // sngas 'bol chung du kan du ko //
analyzed: pa'o // sngas 'bol chung du kan du ko //

analyzed: mar me dang ni rab 'bar dang // p'i tha dang ni stan yin no //

original: tshangs par spyod dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod dang bcas pa'o //

analyzed: sa t'irthy'a ni bla ma gcig / me 'dzin aagni tsi ta'o //

original: brgyud pa nyer bstan de she sy'a dee ti ngyu mi ti h'a bya yam //
analyzed: brgyud pa nyer bstan de she sy'a dee ti ngyu mi ti h'a bya yam //

analyzed: au p'a dzny'a dzny'a na m'a dyam sy'atdzny'a tv'a ram bha au pa kra ma: //

original: p'a tho ho mashts'a ti th'i nam sa par++y'a tar++y'a tar++ya nam ba li: //
analyzed: p'a tho ho mashts'a ti th'i nam sa par++y'a tar++y'a tar++ya nam ba li: //
translated: The one who has the knowledge of the beginning is the one who has the knowledge of the beginning.🔽The one who has the knowledge of the seven tantras is the one who has the seven tantras.🔽The one who has the knowledge of the three is the one who has the three.

analyzed: ae tee: panytsa ma h'a yadzny'a bra hma ya ai ti hya //

analyzed: mi zad nyer shes ye shes rgyags //

analyzed: dzny'a tva rtsom pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The one who has the knowledge of the seven tantras is the

analyzed: a'asth'a ni kli ba ma sth'a ni str'i na pum sa ka yo: sa da: //

analyzed: pr'agbadsha: pr'aggha birge h'atsha da sya bi dha darshi na: //

analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs zhes //

analyzed: tshangs pa 'khor mang 'dus pa dang // sa bh'a tshogs pa khyu dang ni // phung po ma ning aasth'a ni //

analyzed: mo dang ma ning 'dus pa'o //

analyzed: dang po'i brgyud pa dang po la //

analyzed: 'tshogs nas cho ga lta ba'o //

analyzed: 'dun sar tshogs dang 'dun sar rgyu //

analyzed: tshogs pa spyi yi ming yin no //

analyzed: aa dhva r++y'u ngg'a tri ho t'a ro //

analyzed: rig byed sa gzhi yongs su bcos //

analyzed: mtshungs pas gzhi grub bzhi pa //

original: tsa sh'a la ni phyugs btags shing //
analyzed: tsa sh'a la ni phyugs btags shing //

original: bum pa shin tu bri ti: //
analyzed: bum pa shin tu bri ti: //

analyzed: y'u pa grantarmma narmmanthya da ru ni tva ra ni rdva yo: //

analyzed: dakshi n'agnirg'arha pa ty'a ha ba n'i yoo tra yogna ya: //
translated: Dakshinagni, Agni, Paridhishthya, and Havirdhâna are the four.

original: aagni tra ya mi dam tre t'a pra n'i ta: sam skri tonyan la: //
analyzed: aagni tra ya mi dam tre t'a pra n'i ta: sam skri tonyan la: //
translated: Agni, Trayi, Dâma, and Tapas are the four.

original: sa m'u dzya: pa ri ts'a yyo pa ts'a dzy'a bagnoopra yo gi na: //
analyzed: sa m'u dzya: pa ri ts'a yyo pa ts'a dzy'a bagnoopra yo gi na: //
translated: Samûhya, Pariçaya, Upacaya, and Upabhoga are the four.

original: yo g'arha bskor ba'i khyim //
analyzed: yo g'arha bskor ba'i khyim //
translated: The house of the sacrificial fire is called the Vedi.

original: srog shing rtse mo rta ma'o //
analyzed: srog shing rtse mo rta ma'o //
translated: The top of the sacrificial post is called the Ashva.

original: gtsub shing gtsug stan aar na gnyis //
analyzed: gtsub shing gtsug stan aar na gnyis //
translated: The two, the churning stick and the churning staff, are called the Arani.

original: lho yi me dang khyim gyi me //
analyzed: lho yi me dang khyim gyi me //
translated: The southern fire and the domestic fire are the two.

original: ha ba n'i yo me gsum pa //
analyzed: ha ba n'i yo me gsum pa //
translated: The fire of the Havirdhâna is the third.

original: me 'di gsum la tre ta'o //
analyzed: me 'di gsum la tre ta'o //
translated: These three fires are called the Trayi.

original: pra n'i ta ni legs sbyar me //🔽yongs bsags nyer bsags sa m'u dzya //
analyzed: pra n'i ta ni legs sbyar me // yongs bsags nyer bsags sa m'u dzya //
translated: The fire of the Sruk and Sruva is called the Prânita.🔽The fire of the Samûhya and Pariçaya is called the Samûhya.

original: me yi ming la rab sbyor ro //
analyzed: me yi ming la rab sbyor ro //
translated: The fire of the Upacaya and Upabhoga is called the Upabhoga.🔽The fire of the Patyâdâna is in the south.

original: gang zhig pa ty'a d'a n'i ya dakshi n'agni: pra n'i y'a te //
analyzed: gang zhig pa ty'a d'a n'i ya dakshi n'agni: pra n'i y'a te //
translated: In it, the fire of the Nâyanîya is in the north.

original: tasminn'a n'a yyo&amp ;
analyzed: tasminn'a n'a yyo&amp ;
translated: The fire of the Agnâyana is in the east.🔽The fire of the Svaha is in the west.

original: th'agn'a yi sv'a h'a tsa hu ta bhukpri y'a //
analyzed: th'agn'a yi sv'a h'a tsa hu ta bhukpri y'a //
translated: The fire of the Huta and Bhuka is in the south.🔽The fire of the Rikas and Amidhâ is in the north.

original: ri ks'a mi dhe n'i dh'a yy'a tsa y'a sa sy'a gni sa mindha ne //
analyzed: ri ks'a mi dhe n'i dh'a yy'a tsa y'a sa sy'a gni sa mindha ne //
translated: The fire of the Yâs and Sâgni is in the east.🔽The fire of the Sâmi and Mîndha is in the west.

original: g'a ya tr'i pra mu kham tstshando ha bya p'a ke tsa rum bu m'a na //
analyzed: g'a ya tr'i pra mu kham tstshando ha bya p'a ke tsa rum bu m'a na //
translated: Gayatri, Pramuncha, Chandohya, Vyakhya, Kacha, Ruma, Bhumana,

original: a'a m'i ksh'a s'a shri toshne y'a khyim bdag khyim bdag me //
analyzed: a'a m'i ksh'a s'a shri toshne y'a khyim bdag khyim bdag me //

analyzed: g'a ya tr'i la sogs pa'o sdeb //

original: sreg rdzas smin byed tsa ru pho //
analyzed: sreg rdzas smin byed tsa ru pho //

analyzed: 'o ma zho dang @182b ksh'i re sy'adda dhi yo ga ta: //

analyzed: dha bi tram bya dza nam ta dya da tsi tam mri ga tsarmma n'a //

analyzed: p'u sha d'a dzyam sa da dhny'a dzye pa ra m'annam tu p'a ya sa: //
translated: are the four feet of the fire, which is the friend of all.🔽The fire is the friend of the poor, the friend of the rich, the friend of the low, the friend of the high, the friend of the good, the friend of the bad, the friend of the wise, the friend of the foolish.

original: ha bya ka bye dee ba pee tre yanne p'a tram sru p'a di kam //🔽dhru bo pa bhri dzdza h'u n'a tu syu be bha d'a: shru sbyar ba'o //

analyzed: ri dags pags pa dag las so //

analyzed: syurmoo hurtti ka zla dang // de nas bshes dang grogs po gnyen //

analyzed: bya gtong dang ni nang yan gsum //

analyzed: lo shes rtsis mkhan lha shes dang // rtsis grangs yud tsam thang cig moo hurtta dzny'a ni k'artta ti k'a aa pi //

original: t'antri ko dzny'a ta siddh'anta: santr'i gri ha pa ti sa moo //
analyzed: t'antri ko dzny'a ta siddh'anta: santr'i gri ha pa ti sa moo //

original: li pi ka ronyaksha ra tsa nonyaksha ra tsunytsushtsa le kha ko //
analyzed: li pi ka ronyaksha ra tsa nonyaksha ra tsunytsushtsa le kha ko //

analyzed: li khi t'a ksha ra sam sth'a ne li pilli rbi ru bhi: stri yoo //
